value.name: Champagne, oysters and a helicopter ride: New Zealand fugitive surrenders to police in style
value.description: A man in New Zealand hired a helicopter and had a meal of oysters with champagne before surrendering himself to the police after being on the run for five weeks. James Matthew Bryant (32) faces charges including assault,

value.name: New Zealand fugitive charters helicopter to police station
value.description: A man who had been on the run in rural New Zealand hired a helicopter to fly to a police station and surrender. James Bryant, who faces assault charges, spent five weeks apparently hiding in a small town in North Otago.

value.name: NZ fugitive hires helicopter to hand himself in
value.description: A man who had been on the run in rural New Zealand hired a helicopter to fly to a police station and surrender.James Bryant, who faces assault charges, spent five weeks apparently hiding in a small town in North Otago.

value.name: Wanted fugitive rents helicopter to fly to the police station to turn himself in
value.description: For five weeks, police in New Zealand had been on the lookout for 32-year-old Matthew James Bryant, who was wanted in connection with an assault.
